intro: Chironia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed chironia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, making it a notable species in its native habitat.
